familiarity_LLM_programming_other: Check if my logic is correct, evaluating code structure. I use LLMs sometimes for these tasks
LLM_programming_feedback: I like it is able to finish simple functions and discuss ideas. I also very much like how LLMs are able to explain code and concepts.
When I used to program alot, LLMs weren't such a big thing yet. During my masters I dont really program that much anymore.
I value the explanations about concepts or challenges I would not be able to encounter by myself. I like the support it gives me.

It can give me pointers to terms and explanations of things that are hard to search on google (such as a bare latex formula). But the results are still hit-or-miss, it can sometimes give very weird/wrong answers. Because of that, I find it hard to trust the output in general.

familiarity_LLM_programming_other: To clarify the "Writing new code" bit, I myself didn't, but a partner of mine used Chatgpt for code in a shared project.
LLM_programming_feedback: For some reason, I'm not use to it. Similar to how older generations might prefer mail over the Internet, I prefer to use Google/Firefox over LLMs.

I think they are capable at doing simple or menial tasks. Otherwise I believe that you have to put more time into describing the program to them than you would if you just solved the problem yourself with optional help of StackOverflow.

familiarity_LLM_programming_other: Sometimes I use chatGPT to improve the grammar and flow of texts.
LLM_programming_feedback: Quite useful to debug code but does not always work properly.
It can be helpful when I'm not familiar with functions that can trivialize a programming problem
a proper explanation about how the code is constructed
In general LLMs can be sued for writing code, however when there are more specific tasks involved it can be harder for a LLM to write the correct code.

familiarity_LLM_programming_other: I sometimes use ChatGPT to help me with writing motivation letters for job applications, explaining study-related concepts (specifically in physics and mathematics but also programming related), and ask for movie recommendations.
LLM_programming_feedback: As I am still at a relatively basic level in programming, LLMs, so far, have been able to help me understand programming-related concepts better and have also been able to help me understand why my code doesn't work sometimes. I like the fact that LLMs are able to give you a very detailed but understandable overview of complex topics and also offer suggestions in an intuitive way.
It gives help and setup for Code you want to write
